actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for 'Gentleman's Agreement' (1947). She was known for her brilliant comedic timing and her memorable roles in 'All About Eve' and 'High Society'. She originated the role of Ado Annie in the Broadway production of 'Oklahoma!'.

filmography.title: Gentleman's Agreement
filmography.role_description: A chic, sharp-witted fashion editor who befriends a journalist posing as a Jewish man to expose anti-Semitism.
filmography.plot: A reporter pretends to be Jewish in order to cover a story on anti-Semitism, and personally discovers the true depths of bigotry and hatred.

filmography.title: All About Eve
filmography.role_description: The kind-hearted wife of a playwright who unwittingly aids an ambitious fan in infiltrating her friend's life.
filmography.plot: A seemingly timid but secretly ruthless ingénue insinuates herself into the lives of an aging Broadway star and her circle of theater friends.

filmography.title: Come to the Stable
filmography.role_description: A determined French nun who travels to New England with a fellow sister to build a children's hospital.
filmography.plot: Two French nuns arrive in a small New England town with a plan to build a hospital, despite having no money and facing local skepticism.

filmography.title: High Society
filmography.role_description: A cynical photographer covering a high-profile wedding alongside a reporter played by Frank Sinatra.
filmography.plot: A musical remake of 'The Philadelphia Story' in which a wealthy woman's wedding plans are complicated by the arrival of her ex-husband and a tabloid reporter.

filmography.title: The Snake Pit
filmography.role_description: A patient in a psychiatric hospital who befriends the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A woman finds herself in an insane asylum and cannot remember how she got there, leading to a journey through her own subconscious.

filmography.title: A Letter to Three Wives
filmography.role_description: The unseen narrator whose voice drives the plot, taunting three women with the news that she has run off with one of their husbands.
filmography.plot: Three women receive a letter from a mutual friend stating that she has run off with one of their husbands, but she doesn't say which one.

filmography.title: Road House
filmography.role_description: A cashier at a roadside bar who witnesses the tension between a singer, the owner, and the manager.
filmography.plot: A nightclub owner's obsession with his new singer leads to a dangerous triangle involving his old friend and manager.

filmography.title: The Tender Trap
filmography.role_description: An accomplished violinist who is one of the many women pursuing a bachelor theatrical agent.
filmography.plot: A womanizing theatrical agent finds his lifestyle threatened when he falls for a woman who wants marriage.

filmography.title: Three Little Girls in Blue
filmography.role_description: One of three sisters who travel to Atlantic City in search of rich husbands. Holm's film debut.
filmography.plot: Three sisters from the farm belt inherit some money and head to Atlantic City to catch wealthy husbands.

filmography.title: Champagne for Caesar
filmography.role_description: A woman hired by a soap company executive to distract a genius contestant on a quiz show.
filmography.plot: An unemployed genius gets revenge on a soap company by going on their quiz show and winning millions.

filmography.title: Chicken Every Sunday
filmography.role_description: The long-suffering wife of a man with many failed get-rich-quick schemes, who takes in boarders to make ends meet.
filmography.plot: A woman supports her family by taking in boarders while her husband pursues various unsuccessful business ventures.

filmography.title: Tom Sawyer
filmography.role_description: The stern but loving aunt of Tom Sawyer in this musical adaptation of Mark Twain's novel.
filmography.plot: A musical adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale about a mischievous boy growing up in Missouri.

filmography.title: Three Men and a Baby
filmography.role_description: The mother of Ted Danson's character, who visits and discovers the baby.
filmography.plot: Three bachelors represent the ultimate in freedom until a baby is left on their doorstep.

filmography.title: Everybody Does It
filmography.role_description: An aspiring opera singer with no talent whose husband surprisingly becomes a singing sensation.
filmography.plot: A man tries to sabotage his wife's singing career but ends up becoming a successful singer himself.

filmography.title: Cinderella
filmography.role_description: The magical godmother who helps Cinderella attend the ball in this Rodgers and Hammerstein musical. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A musical retelling of the classic fairy tale about a mistreated stepdaughter who wins the heart of a prince.

filmography.title: Carnival in Costa Rica
filmography.role_description: A woman arranged to marry a man who is in love with someone else.
filmography.plot: Two pairs of lovers try to overcome their parents' arranged marriage plans during a carnival in Costa Rica.

filmography.title: Backstairs at the White House
filmography.role_description: The First Lady and wife of Warren G. Harding in this acclaimed miniseries.
filmography.plot: The lives of several US Presidents as seen through the eyes of the White House staff.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited Series

filmography.title: Bachelor Flat
filmography.role_description: The fiancée of a British professor who gets involved in romantic misunderstandings.
filmography.plot: A British professor moves to California and finds himself the object of affection for several women living in his building.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy (Film)

filmography.title: Doctor, You've Got to Be Kidding!
filmography.role_description: The ambitious mother of a young woman who wants to be a singer.
filmography.plot: A young woman about to give birth tells the story of her three potential fathers and her overbearing mother.

filmography.title: Captain China
filmography.role_description: A passenger on a ship who becomes involved with a disgraced captain attempting to clear his name.
filmography.plot: A sea captain who lost his ship due to a drunken mate tries to regain his command and his reputation.

filmography.title: Bittersweet Love
filmography.role_description: The mother who reveals a shocking secret about the relationship between a young married couple.
filmography.plot: A happily married couple expecting a child discovers that they are actually half-brother and sister.

filmography.title: Still Breathing
filmography.role_description: The grandmother of a puppeteer who has a vision of his soulmate.
filmography.plot: A puppeteer in Texas has a vision of a woman in Los Angeles and travels there to find her.

filmography.title: The Private Files of J. Edgar Hoover
filmography.role_description: The mother of J. Edgar Hoover, who had a strong influence on his life.
filmography.plot: A biopic of the legendary FBI director J. Edgar Hoover, exploring his career and private life.

filmography.title: Polly
filmography.role_description: A character in this musical adaptation of 'Pollyanna' featuring an African-American cast. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A musical version of the story of an orphan girl who brings optimism to a cynical town.

filmography.title: Driving Me Crazy
filmography.role_description: Holm's final film role, playing the grandmother in this comedy.
filmography.plot: A writer tries to find inspiration for his new script while dealing with his eccentric family.
